title: ANSIS Soil Domain Entity Schema
description: JSON Schema definitions of the complete list of entities (features in GIS speak) defined in or imported by the ANSIS Domain Ontology.
$comment: Instances of entities can be created/validated using the entity-instance and entity-instance-collection schema.

SoilSite.title: ANSIS Soil Site
SoilSite.description: A site where samples, observations, and treatments of soil are carried out.

SoilProfile.title: ANSIS Soil Profile
SoilProfile.description: A soil profile is a vertical section of a soil from the soil surface through all its horizons to parent material, other consolidated substrate material or selected depth in unconsolidated material.

SoilBody.title: ANSIS Soil Body
SoilBody.description: Part of the soil cover that is delineated at a scale useful for an application, and is homogeneous with regard to properties and/or spatial patterns.

SoilLayer.title: ANSIS Soil Layer
SoilLayer.description: Region within a soil body usually observed as a specified depth interval within a profile.

SoilHorizon.title: ANSIS Soil Horizon
SoilHorizon.description: Soil layer which is compositionally and/or structurally homogeneous, delineated by pedological boundaries.

SoilSample.title: ANSIS Soil Sample
SoilSample.description: Sample of soil or soil entity. Sample is a key class in the context of observations. The sample is an intermediate object, which is intended to be representative of the entity that we wish to characterize. The relationship of the sample to the ultimate entity-of-interest is recorded through the following properties: - `sosa:isSampleOf` to indicate the entity that this sample represents; - `ansis:component` (if necessary) to indicate which component of the entity the observation related to, such as coarse-fragments or mottles; - `ansis:relatedProfile` to indicate the 'profile' where it is taken (this may be a formal, complete profile, or an informal profile such as a shallow auger or shovel location); - `ansis:depth-lower` + `ansis:depth-upper` (if necessary) to indicate the precise depth range within the profile where the sample was taken.

component.$comment: No defintion of component type beyond 'owl:Class'.

LandSurveySite.title: ANSIS Land Survey Site
LandSurveySite.description: A Site established to make observations of landscape entities.

SoilSurface.title: ANSIS Soil Surface
SoilSurface.description: The surface of the soil body.

Substrate.title: ANSIS Substrate
Substrate.description: Observed or inferred materials and masses of earth or rock that do not show pedological development. They are not soils, but typically underlie them. The substrate includes the R horizon and that part of the C horizon that shows no pedological development, but excludes the solum, buried soil horizons (including D horizons), and pans. The substrate beneath a soil profile may or may not be the parent material of the soil.

LandSurface.title: ANSIS Land Surface
LandSurface.description: Surface landscape features of a site.

Landform.title: ANSIS Landform
Landform.description: Landscape features within which the site is located

Classification.title: ANSIS Classification
Classification.description: The classifier for an entity - used when an ANSIS vocabulary is not available but a formal vocabulary (the `source`) does, or should, exist.
Classification.$comment: Expands scope of ansis:SoilClassification to support the classification of other entity types.

SiteVisit.title: ANSIS Site Visit
SiteVisit.description: A visit to a designated site, for the purpose of taking samples, making observations, and other activities.
